[[4d6d1]][[4d6d1]][[4d6d1]][[4d6d1]][[4d6d1]][[4d6d1]]

These numbers may be arranged in any order.
If you dont like these stats you may do 27-point buy with this calculator: http://1-dot-encounter-planner.appspot.com/point-buy-calculator.html

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCC8zXWnXUzinvvkxqo_description
attribs.current:
Make a token on http://rolladvantage.com/tokenstamp/ upload the token as your character image, and change the character name with this format:

PC Name (Game ID)

This is so the character can be assigned to you and a token can be made even while you are offline. if you fail to follow these instructions the character will eventually get deleted.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCIBJnOXm0OOkdBZy2f_description
attribs.current: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light.  You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCIBWtcUZjSqZHCLGsK_description
attribs.current: When you damage a creature with an attack or a spell and the creature's size is larger than yours, you can cause the attack or spell to deal extra damage to the creature.  The extra damage equals your level.  Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCIBjDD5XGHCwLSbYVJ_description
attribs.current: You can take the disengage or hide action as a bonus action on each of your turns.

attribs.name: character_appearance
attribs.current:
Standing 3'6", the goblin carries itself in a rather unusual manner to most of his kin.  The other noticeable difference is this goblin's skin isn't red or green, but rather a very ashy and grey look, as if it had been singed and burnt over and over.
   It's posture is more upright, and it wears clothing that look more well-kept then the normal rags and scraps goblins seem to wear.  It also talks common in less broken tongue.

attribs.name: character_backstory
attribs.current:
Flintfang had the unfortunate luck of being born under the presence of a phoenix that was traveling over their goblin clan.  As such, a mysterious magic was formed within the child.

The unfortunate part is that there was a hunting party chasing after the phoenix, looking to claim its feathers for their magical prowess.  Instead, the dwarves came across the goblin clan lands.  Angry that they were unable to catch the phoenix, the dwarves decided to vent their frustration on the clan. 

Though as they started slaughtering them, a cry was heard.  The leader walked towards it, only to see a small goblin, wreathed in flames and screaming in agony.  Its eyes glowed a fiery red.  The leader instantly knew a portion of the phoenix's magic infused into the child.

Taking the goblin babe, the rest of the tribe was slaughtered and the goblin taken back to the city.  There, the hunting party presented the child to the ruling council, and explained the nature of why it was kept alive.  They could turn the child into a weapon.

Named Flintfang, the goblin was inducted into the hunting party, under the guidance of those that had slaughtered its family.  There, it was instructed on how to master its sorcerous powers, and though volatile, they proved effective.

Eventually, the hunting party was revealed to be a highly trained team of operatives working for the council, following the laws of the city they created, and enforcing its will when necessary.  As such, Flintfang's nature was very un-goblin-esque.

This presented itself when the hunting party came across another clan of goblins on one of their missions.  Unaware that these were his kin, they shouted at him in a language he didn't understand.  And as he burned and seared their flesh away, one cursed him in goblin and told him malgubiyet would claim him if he kept attacking his own people.

Confused by this, Flintfang spent his off-time in the libraries learning more about these goblins and their culture.  He studied their language, and learned to speak it...but this didn't go without being noticed by his commanding officer.

Overhearing a conversation one night from his leader to the council, they were discussing what to do with them.  The leader explained that the goblin was growing more interested in its own culture, and might eventually learn the truth about his clan and go looking.  The council, unpleased at the idea of losing a powerful weapon, ruled to kill the goblin, rather than risk it turning its volatile power against them.  

Flintfang ran off to his room, scared and unsure what to do until a knock came.  It was the entire party.  When he inquired what it was about, they said they had just received a new mission and needed to leave immediately.  They led Flintfang into the woods, but he knew what was really about to happen.

Before he could run, the sword plunged into his back.  He felt the blood surge forth from his mouth, but it was hot.  Hotter than it should have been.  He soon realized why, as the life drained from him, the fire within him surged forth in a heated explosion igniting the area ablaze.

His skin was charred, the smell of burning flesh stinging his nose as he looked at the bodies laying on the ground.  Unsure if they were alive or dead, he wasted no time.  With the forest ablaze, the smoke would call more and he needed to make his escape.  

So he just ran...and kept running.

attribs.name: repeating_proficiencies_-LCKMnaz-dgUQFinFD6B_name
attribs.current: Simple Weapons, Hand crossbows, Longswords, rapiers, shortswords

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LCKNFwBhJ6MaHCrfNh7_itemcontent
attribs.current: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LCKNHQ5Yk3jTDuXmH-V_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d4, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 20/60

attribs.current:
Includes:

• a backpack

• a bedroll

• a mess kit

• a tinderbox

• 10 torches

• 10 days of rations

• a waterskin

• 50 feet of hempen rope

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LCKNMTf2imtdpyeSDIX_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon (see "Improvised Weapons" later in the section). A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LCKNMTf2imtdpyeSDIX_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Ranged Weapon, Damage: 1d6, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 80/320

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LCKNOZjcbmFqAzNWD5H_itemcontent
attribs.current: A quiver can hold up to 20 arrows.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LCKNQSz13wWMCaMCkS3_itemcontent
attribs.current: Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LCKNSnK4xUe3n7BUkaP_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d6, Damage Type: Piercing

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCKPRBSm2UNoZPNZp9H_description
attribs.current:
You have created a second identity that includes documentation, established acquaintances, and disguises that allow you to assume that persona.

Additionally, you can forge documents including official papers and personal letters, as long as you have seen an example of the kind of document or handwriting you are trying to copy.

attribs.name: bonds
attribs.current: I was ordered to be killed by the ruling council of the city I grew up in.  When my team tried to kill me, my power ignited and burned them allowing me to escape.  I am unsure if they are still alive or not, as I fled...but if they are, I imagine they want revenge.

attribs.name: flaws
attribs.current: You can't help but be tempted to see if new things you encounter are flammable.

attribs.name: ideals
attribs.current: Freedom.  Chains are meant to be broken, as are those who would forge them.

attribs.name: personality_traits
attribs.current: Thinking is for other people.  I prefer action.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LCKR0NCDMrkyeBnoRz2_itemcontent
attribs.current: This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to disarm traps or open locks.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCKR1eqzCfisJ7M0dEb_description
attribs.current:
At 1st level, choose two of your skill proficiences, or one of your skill proficiencies and your proficiency with thieves' tools.  Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.
   At 6th level, you can choose two more of your proficiencies (in skills or with thieves' tools) to gain this benefit.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCKRHWUGX-E3bJdFW24_description
attribs.current:
Beginning at 1st level, you know how to strike subtly and exploit a foe's distraction.  Once per turn, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage to a creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage on the attack roll.  The attack must use a finess or a ranged weapon.  
   You don't need advantage on the attack if the another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn't incapacitated, and you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll.
   The amount of the extra damage increases as you g ain levels in this class, as shown in the Sneak Attack column of the Rogue table.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCKReINLP20Lkw8KbXq_description
attribs.current:
During your rogue training you learned thieves' cant, a secret mix of dialect, jargon, and code that allows you to hide messages in seemingly normal conversation.  Only another creature that knows thieves' cant understands such messages.  It takes four times longer to convey such a message than it does to speak the same idea plainly.
   In addition, you understand a set of secret signs and sumbols used to convey short, simple messages, such as whether an area is dangerous or the territory of a thieves' guild, whether loot is nearby, or whether the people in the area are easy marks or will provide a safe house for thieves on the run.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LCKT-8KG5RxTJ9Xcfq7_spelldescription
attribs.current:
You hurl a mote of fire at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

This spell's damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LCKTJ7nHaQ1ArwaX0d6_spelldescription
attribs.current:
Until the spells ends, a magic bonfire fills a 5-foot cube. Any creature in the bonfire's space must succeed a Dexterity save or take 1d8 fire damage. A creature must also make the saving throw when it moves into the bonfire’s space or ends its turn there.

The bonfire ignites flammable objects in its area that aren't being worn or carried.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LCKTJ7nHaQ1ArwaX0d6_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: The spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th, 11th, and 17th level.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LCKTTnO1Wx6RI7fJSgI_spelldescription
attribs.current:
You choose nonmagical flame that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You affect it in one of the following ways:

You expand the flame 5 feet in one direction if fuel is present in the new location.

You extinguish the flames within the cube.

You double or halve the area of bright light and dim light cast by the flame, change its color, or both. The change lasts for 1 hour.

You cause simple shapes to appear within the flames and animate as you like. The shapes last for 1 hour.

If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCKU5TdNBdBgUL-fL5d_description
attribs.current: At 1st level, you gain the ability to start fires with a touch.  As an action, you can magically ignite a flammable object you touch with your hand --- an object such as a torch, a piece of tinder, or the hem of drapes.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCKUIgbdZxZqJEXTgSL_description
attribs.current:
Starting at 1st level, you can unleash the phoenix fire that blazes within you.  As a bonus action, you magically wreath yourself in swirling fire, as your eyes glow like hot coals.  For 1 minute, you gain the following benefits:

- You shed bright light in a 30 foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

- Any creature takes fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier if it hits you with a melee attack from within 5 feet of you or if it touches you.

- Whenever you roll fire damage on your turn, the roll gains a bonus equal to your Charisma modifier.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LCKVyy4VQTu56x5MCqM_spelldescription
attribs.current:
This spell repairs a single break or tear in an object you touch, such as broken chain link, two halves of a broken key, a torn clack, or a leaking wineskin. As long as the break or tear is no larger than 1 foot in any dimension, you mend it, leaving no trace of the former damage.

This spell can physically repair a magic item or construct, but the spell can't restore magic to such an object.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCKW6xtBzAbaZgnuhDt_description
attribs.current: You have 2 soercery points, and gain more as you reach higher levels.  You can never have more sorcery points than shown on the table for your level.  You regain all spent sorcery points when you finish a long rest.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCKWGjTxC3d-xWIOx0u_description
attribs.current:
You can transform unexpended sorcery points into one spell slot as a bonus action on your turn.  You can create spell slots no higher in level than 5th.

Level 1 = 2 points
Level 2 = 3 points
Level 3 = 5 points
Level 4 = 6 points
Level 5 = 7 points

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCKWWwMSYWyf3eFL6Zk_description
attribs.current: As a bonus action on your turn, you can expend one spell slot and gain a number of sorcery points equal to the slot's level.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCKWomZO6aHgntEdu-s_description
attribs.current:
At 3rd level you gain the ability to twist your spells to suit your needs.  Gain 2 metamagic options.  Gain another at 10th and 17th level.
   You can use only one metamagic option on a spell when you cast it, unless otherwise noted.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCKXBuTTfaPfaoFGxqu_description
attribs.current: When you cast a spell, you can spend 1 sorcery point to cast it without any somatic or verbal components

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCKXJTf9XoMsbyNCAl1_description
attribs.current: When you cast a spell that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, you can protect some of those creatures from the spell's full force.  To do so, you spend 1 sorcery point and choose a number of those creatures up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one).  A chosen creature automatically succeeds on its saving throw against the spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LCKYX0JKif1CGZpxHOx_spelldescription
attribs.current: An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LCKZCZDFPcJp1dgkXlY_spelldescription
attribs.current:
You create three rays of fire and hurl them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several.

Make a ranged spell attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 fire damage.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LCKZCZDFPcJp1dgkXlY_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you create one additional ray for each slot level above 2nd.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LCKZCaaZ0xWbJsd49no_atk_desc
attribs.current:
You create three rays of fire and hurl them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several.

Make a ranged spell attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 fire damage.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LCKZuFWlwulHyUF8IpY_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: An eyelash encased in gum arabic

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LCKZuFWlwulHyUF8IpY_spelldescription
attribs.current: A creature you touch becomes invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is invisible as long as it is on the target's person. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LCKZuFWlwulHyUF8IpY_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LCKaEo3XxTB9orh8Hyo_spelldescription
attribs.current: A line of fire 30 feet long and 5 feet wide shoots from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 3d8 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LCKaEo3XxTB9orh8Hyo_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: The damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LCKaVp8gPXTANLLL2rZ_atk_desc
attribs.current: The damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCKatdiGZ49ljZKmbrt_description
attribs.current:
When you gain this feat, choose one of the following damage types: FIRE

Spells you cast ignore resistance to damage of the chosen type.  In addition, when you roll damage for a spell you cast that deals damage of that type, you can treat any 1 on a damage die as a 2.

You can select this feat multiple times.  Each time you do so, you must choose a different damage type.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LCKeKbrMH4scyVBDBCz_atk_desc
attribs.current: Any creature  that hits you with a melee attack from within 5 feet of you, or that touches you.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LCKeYYpUncSpwTYWx2i_atk_desc
attribs.current: When you damage a creature with an attack or a spell and the creature's size is larger than yours, you can cause the attack or spell to deal extra damage to the creature.  The extra damage equals your level.  Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LCLatT3-xqS9iAl3DZ8_spelldescription
attribs.current:
You create one of the following effects at a visible point within range:

One medium or smaller creature that you choose must succeed on a Strength save or be pushed up to 5 feet away from you.

You create a small blast of air that moves one object up to 5 lbs that isn't held or carried. The object is gently pushed up to 10 feet away from you.

You create a harmless sensory effect using air.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LCM-kJF6qxUw4HP6ckY_atk_desc
attribs.current: Until the spells ends, a magic bonfire fills a 5-foot cube. Any creature in the bonfire's space must succeed a Dexterity save or take 1d8 fire damage. A creature must also make the saving throw when it moves into the bonfire’s space or ends its turn there.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LCPJW84bkobNjGyZiB3_itemcontent
attribs.current:
This necklace has 1d6 + 3 beads hanging from it. You can use an action to detach a bead and throw it up to 60 feet away. When it reaches the end of its trajectory, the bead detonates as a 3rd-level fireball spell (save DC 15).

You can hurl multiple beads, or even the whole necklace, as one action. When you do so, increase the level of the fireball by 1 for each bead beyond the first.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LCPJZEV6HBVO84I5NUj_itemcontent
attribs.current: You regain 2d4 + 2 hit points when you drink this potion.  The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-LCPL1MntQFwpMharflw_spelltarget
attribs.current: Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-LCPL1MntQFwpMharflw_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: A tiny ball of bat guano and sulfur

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-LCPL1MntQFwpMharflw_spelldescription
attribs.current:
A bright streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 8d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-LCPL1MntQFwpMharflw_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LCUiD0bkXW40pEJa8qi_atk_desc
attribs.current:
After drinking this potion, you can use a bonus action to exhale fire at a target within 30 feet of you. The target must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The effect ends after you exhale the fire three times or when 1 hour has passed. 
This potion's orange liquid flickers, and smoke fills the top of the container and wafts out whenever it is opened.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-LDk1cLYW1fLx80b9Qks_spelltarget
attribs.current: Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-LDk1cLYW1fLx80b9Qks_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: A tiny ball of bat guano and sulfur

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-LDk1cLYW1fLx80b9Qks_spelldescription
attribs.current:
A bright streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 8d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-LDk1cLYW1fLx80b9Qks_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LDk2JjF8fOl6BSTJJCe_spelldescription
attribs.current: Make a ranged spell attack against a creature you can see.  You choose the damage type: Acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder.  If the attack hits, the creature takes 3d8 damage of the type you chose.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LDk2JjF8fOl6BSTJJCe_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: The damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LDk2cdoVagcZT7EP0mX_atk_desc
attribs.current:
Make a ranged spell attack against a creature you can see.  You choose the damage type: Acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder.  If the attack hits, the creature takes 3d8 damage of the type you chose.

The damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.
